data.name: Fish pwd
data.description:
Write a function that returns [fish](https://fishshell.com)-like pwd.

For example `/home/username/projects/fork/react` path in the fish terms should be `~/p/f/react`.

Fish pwd follows several rules:
  * if path starts with a home directory it repleces with `~` (`/home/username/projects` => `~/projects`).
  * all previous directories in a path are replaced with their first letters (`/etc/nginx/sites-enabled` => `/e/n/sites-enabled`).
  * if previous directory is hidden (starts with `.`) it includes also `.` before the first letter (`/home/username/.dotfiles/bash` => `~/.d/bash`).

**Examples (for /home/username)**:

| Pwd                                           | Fish Pwd             | Home             |
|-----------------------------------------------|----------------------|------------------|
| `/`                                           | `/`                  | `/home/username` |
| `/tmp`                                        | `/tmp`               | `/home/username` |
| `/etc/nginx/sites-enabled`                    | `/e/n/sites-enabled` | `/home/username` |
| `/tmp/.hidden/out`                            | `/t/.h/out`          | `/home/username` |
| `/home/username`                              | `~`                  | `/home/username` |
| `/home/username/projects`                     | `~/projects`         | `/home/username` |
| `/home/username/projects/own/octavo`          | `~/p/o/octavo`       | `/home/username` |
| `/home/username/.dotfiles`                    | `~/.dotfiles`        | `/home/username` |
| `/home/username/.dotfiles/bash/lib/functions` | `~/.d/b/l/functions` | `/home/username` |
